Esordio

Published on January 22, 2025 | By JW

Time is the enemy of all, but particularly of the perfectionist. As one with such tendencies, I find my creativity oft stifled by half-finished projects that never see the light of day due to the self-imposed, unattainable standards to which they are ruthlessly subjected. One of my high school English teachers routinely set aside 10 minutes at the beginning of class for us to write on a topic. No judgment, no frills, no grades outside of a completion grade at the end of the quarter. It seemed silly at first—I was just jotting down dross. But I found myself looking forward more and more to that part of class. It became surprisingly refreshing.

My aspiration for this blog is to serve as a repository of both undeveloped and developed thoughts, of impulsive drafts and of polished pieces. I have the unfortunate tendency of neglecting projects without deadlines, and I expect this one to not be the exception. Still, this is truly my website—for the first time ever—so I will return to tend the garden, if not when the lilacs are in full bloom, then when they have sunk into the untilled soil, awaiting the moment of salvation when the golden light will rise above their delicate petals and shed light on their weary souls once again.
